intro: Omphalea palmata, commonly known as the yellow arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and can be quite large, contributing to its ornamental value. Omphalea palmata is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist environments.
